result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Theft Of Mail (Less Than 10 Pieces Of Mail)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Alexander Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Alexander in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Michael Alexander in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Per plea negotiations and on the State's motion, Court ordered case dismissed and read into 22CF1019.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Michael Alexander not in court, in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status along with defendant's pending felony case. Defense is requesting a plea hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 8-5-22 at 1:30 pm for a status conference.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Michael Alexander not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Defendant has a pending matter in Branch 28 and defense counsel requests global transfer.  Court allows for transfer to Branch 28 for global resolution. If cases do not globally resolve, Court ordered case adjourned for status in Branch 37.
Case adjourned for status in Branch 28. 
  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Michael Alexander in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Michael Alexander in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Alexander appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Alexander not in court, defendant in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 06-14-2022. Defendant is in custody at CJF. Needs to be produced for court.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/14/2022 @1p
